title: White House warns American citizens not to count on evacuation from Sudan
description: The White House says it won’t evacuate Americans from Sudan as the country is embroiled in conflict.

title: Supreme Court keeps status quo on abortion pill for now, Thomas and Alito dissent
description: The ongoing litigation has major implications for access to the abortion pill.

title: Canada says it could offer access to an abortion drug if US ban is upheld
description: A press secretary for the Canada's Families Minister Karina Gould told ABC News the country could offer access to mifepristone if it is banned in the United States.

title: Attorneys for Hunter Biden expected to meet next week with prosecutors: Sources
description: Attorneys for Hunter Biden are expected to meet next week with federal prosecutors to discuss the status of the probe into the president's son, sources tell ABC News.

title: Vermont police hunt for 'armed and dangerous' man after shootout incident
description: A search is underway in Vermont for a man who fired a shotgun at an officer, police said.

title: Republican presidential hopefuls struggle to answer on abortion
description: ABC News contacted the campaigns of 10 GOP candidates who are either running for president or have indicated an interest in running to ask their stance on mifepristone.

title: Toddler shot, left at fire station in critical condition: Police
description: A toddler in a Washington town is hospitalized after police found them in a firehouse with a gunshot wound.

title: How to apply for the $725M Facebook privacy settlement
description: Facebook users who had an account at any time from May 2007 to the end of last year can now apply for their share of a $725 million privacy settlement.

title: Minnesota officer who fatally shot Daunte Wright to be freed
description: A white ex-police officer convicted of manslaughter after mistaking her handgun for a Taser and fatally shooting a Black motorist in suburban Minneapolis in 2021 is set to be released from prison on Monday

title: Weekly COVID deaths hit the lowest point since the start of the pandemic
description: A new CDC report found that weekly COVID-19 deaths in the United States have hit their lowest levels seen since March 2020.

title: 3rd man arrested for allegedly making death threat against Florida sheriff
description: A third out-of-state man was arrested this week for allegedly posting an online death threat against a sheriff who denounced antisemitism in his Florida county.

title: Gun in fatal 'Rust' shooting could fire without pressure on trigger, source says
description: The decision to drop charges against Alec Baldwin over the fatal "Rust" shooting was made after investigators found the gun was mechanically improper, a source said.

title: 1 dead, 2 hurt in fiery fuel tanker truck crash
description: A fuel tanker truck rolled over on the Gold Star Bridge in Groton, Connecticut, sparking a massive fire.

title: Sudan fighting persists on Eid holiday despite 72-hour cease-fire announcement
description: Deadly clashes in Sudan between forces loyal to two rival generals appeared to continue Friday, despite both sides agreeing to a three-day truce on humanitarian grounds.

title: WATCH:  Prince William, Kate play game of darts with others at Birmingham pub
description: The Prince and Princess of Wales enjoyed a game of darts at The Rectory pub on April 20, 2023.

title: Tornadoes possible in Mid-Atlantic as storms set to drench East Coast
description: Tornadoes are possible in the Mid-Atlantic states as a storm heads toward the East Coast bringing heavy rain.

title: Feds get first guilty plea in Michigan marijuana board probe
description: A businessman has pleaded guilty to bribing the head of a Michigan marijuana licensing board, the first conviction in a federal investigation into payoffs and other benefits

title: Appeals court returns E. Jean Carroll defamation case to district judge
description: An appeals court has returned E. Jean Carroll's defamation case to a judge who had rejected former President Trump's claim that he was acting in his official capacity.

title: White House: No evacuation plans for all Americans in Sudan
description: The Pentagon has deployed forces and is developing options to assist in the possible evacuation of U.S. Embassy personnel from Sudan, but the White House said Friday there are no plans for now for a broader pullout of the potentially thousands of other...

title: 20 years later, 'infatuated' ex-boyfriend arrested in young woman's 2003 murder
description: A New York man has been arrested for the March 14, 2003, killing of his ex-girlfriend, 20-year-old Megan McDonald, according to authorities.

title: NFL suspends 5 players for violating gambling policy
description: The NFL has suspended five players for violating the league’s gambling policy

title: WATCH:   'Largest cat' finds forever home after going viral
description: Patches, a cat who weighs 40.3 pounds, was spotlighted by Richmond Animal Care and Control before being adopted by retiree Kay Ford, who plans to help him on a weight-loss journey.

title: After 4 US price cuts, Tesla raises cost for older models
description: After cutting U.S. vehicle prices four times this year, Tesla raised them overnight on its slow-selling more expensive models

title: Who is running for president in 2024 and who might run
description: Who is running for president in 2024? Here's a list of every presidential candidate who has confirmed so far and a look at some potential contenders.

title: Credit Suisse investors sue after facing billions in losses
description: A group of Credit Suisse investors have sued Swiss financial regulators after a government-engineered takeover of the struggling bank by rival UBS left them with billions in losses

title: 4 million apply for tickets for Paris Olympics in lottery
description: Four million applications were received for an online lottery where winners get to buy tickets for next year’s Paris Olympics

title: Once-a-week nightmare: US mass killings on a record pace
description: The U.S. is setting a record pace for mass killings this year

title: 20-year-old fatally struck by large rock while driving, 1 of 5 similar incidents
description: A large rock killed a 20-year-old driver in one of at least five similar incidents in Colorado over three hours on Wednesday evening.

title: WATCH:  Rubik’s Cube phenom sets new world record while multitasking
description: Wang Yibo, 15, set the Guinness World Record for dribbling a basketball while solving a Rubik’s Cube in 14.35 seconds.

title: Elon Musk's Twitter drops government-funded media labels
description: Twitter has removed labels describing global media organizations are government-funded or state-affiliated

title: UK deputy prime minister quits after bullying investigation
description: U.K. Deputy Prime Minister Dominic Raab has resigned after an independent investigation into complaints that he bullied civil servants

title: How PFAS are entering America's water supply
description: PFAS are known to cause serious health issues and are seeping into America's water supply, endangering millions of people who have been using the contaminated water .

title: 10 members of same family dead in mass shooting in S. Africa
description: Police say 10 members of the same family, seven of them women, were killed in a mass shooting at a house in South Africa

title: North Korea calls its nukes 'stark reality,' criticizes G-7
description: North Korea’s foreign minister has called the Group of Seven wealthy democracies a “tool for ensuring the U.S. hegemony” as she lambasted the group’s recent call for the North’s denuclearization

title: American Airlines employee dies after tarmac incident at Austin airport
description: An airline employee at the Austin-Bergstrom International Airport was killed in a tarmac incident Thursday afternoon, authorities said.
